description: From Middle French aversion, from Latin āversiō. Doublet of aversio.

entries.meaning: Opposition or repugnance of mind; fixed dislike often without any conscious reasoning.
examples: Due to her aversion to the outdoors she complained throughout the entire camping trip.

entries.meaning: An object of dislike or repugnance.
examples: Pushy salespeople are a major aversion of mine.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The act of turning away from an object.
